hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Overnight Gap Close
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes (confidence 55-70%), overnight price gaps (>0.8% between 00:00-04:00 UTC) close within the first 2 hours of London trading (07:00-09:00 UTC) 75% of the time, regardless of gap direction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack sustained directional momentum. Overnight gaps are often liquidity-driven (Asian retail/algos). London's institutional flow provides mean-reverting pressure as market-makers fade illiquid moves. Current $88K BTC is in a consolidation zone where gaps get filled.
entry_conditions: Overnight gap >0.8% exists between 00:00 and 04:00 UTC
Enter at 07:00 UTC in gap-closing direction
Additional filter: Gap represents >1.5x average 4-hour volatility

exit_conditions.take_profit: Gap fully closed (price reaches pre-gap level)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Gap widens by additional 0.4% from 07:00 UTC level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If <60% of gaps close within the 2-hour window during neutral regimes, or if gaps consistently trend continuation.
